content:
Ak máte POP prístup k svojim účtom, tak to ide nastaviť cez "Globálnu schránku prijatej pošty". Táto funkcia umožňuje prijímať poštu z viacerých účtov POP do jednej schránky v lokálnych priečinkoch. Môžete si vybrať, či chcete do globálnej schránky doručovať zo všetkých, alebo iba z niektorých účtov POP. Každý účet, ktorý nebude používať globálnu schránku, bude mať svoju skupinu priečinkov, vrátane priečinka prijatej pošty, a budú zobrazené v paneli priečinkov. Účty, ktoré používajú globálnu schránku, nebudú mať tieto priečinky zobrazené, namiesto toho sa použije skupina v Lokálnych priečinkoch.

Keď v Thunderbirde vytvárate nový účet POP, sprievodca sa vás spýta, či s ním chcete použiť globálnu schránku. Ak áno, ubezpečte sa, že políčko tejto možnosti je označené. Ak globálnu schránku s týmto účtom použiť nechcete, políčko musí byť prázdne. http://imgbank.cz/images/2019/03/25/Thunderbird-globalna-databaza.jpg

Zmena nastavenia pre už existujúci účet POP: Dôležité. Ak sú v priečinkoch tohto účtu už nejaké správy, mali by ste ich skopírovať alebo premiestniť do lokálnych priečinkov ešte predtým ako začnete používať účet s globálnou schránkou. Ak správy nepremiestnite a globálnu schránku budete používať, tento účet sa už nezobrazí v paneli priečinkov a vy nebudete môcť pristupovať k správam, pokiaľ neodstránite nastavenie globálneho priečinka pre tento účet. http://imgbank.cz/images/2019/03/25/Thunderbird-globalna.jpg

Toto neplatí pre IMAP účty - tie musia mať samostatnú (vlastnú) štruktúru. Každý IMAP účet bude mať svoju skupinu priečinkov, vrátane priečinka prijatej pošty.
creator: Ansamb

content:
Dobrý den, děkuji za odpověď. Mám oba účtu od Seznamu, tzn. IMAP. Po vaší zúrávě jsem vzdal snahu o změnu.

Pak jsem si vzpomněl, že jsem před novou instalací Windows dělal z Thunderbirdu nějakou zálohu (v Nástrojích je Importovat a Exportovat). Našel jsem soubor Thunderbird_profile_backup.zip na druhém disku. A po Importu se najednou znovu objevila ikona Rozšířené. Děkuji za pomoc. S pozdravem
creator: leosve

content: The attached picture shows the Header Pane when Compact Headers is set to show single-line headers (right-click the pane for options). It also shows the icon next to the Quick Filter button to select Table or Cards view. Enable the Message List Header under View/Layout to show the icon.
creator: sfhowes

content: I don't think you're getting what I'm trying to fix. It's not the font size of the headers or any other menu item. It's the inability to drag the border between the message list, and the current message being viewed upwards, so that the message list is only 3 or 4 messages deep vertically, leaving the majority of the screen area below it allocated to the currently chosen viewed message from the list. This while I'm using the Classic View window pane option. It currently can't be dragged upwards indefinitely, which would solve my problem. I'm forced to see 9.5 messages in the upper message list area. If I only have 3 or 4 messages in any folder's list, there's a 5+ line gap (wasted screen space) below them until the border/divider is reached. This also means that I'm only able to view 5 or 6 lines of text in any selected/viewed message, with the header displayed at the top of the currently viewed message. How can I post a screen print to the forum, to display an example of what I'm talking about? It's in .jpg format.
creator: MrSensible

content: See the attached screen print with text on top of the dividing border that I want to be able to adjust farther upwards by drag and drop.
creator: MrSensible

content: There is an 'add images' below the area where text is entered on the forum. I have seen many comments here on that issue with classic view. I just posted a bug report on bugzilla about this.
creator: davidsk

content:
A decision was made by the UX folk that the message list space would by enforced as a larger window with the 115 release. Sorry you don't like it, but it is hard coded into the application and is not something that is user configurable.

There is a feedback forum on the Thunderbird help menu. I suggest you use it if you disagree with their decision. You certainly would not be alone.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Hi david, yes, thanks, I figured that out and posted my screen print image. It was a Homer Simpson "doh" moment for me.

creator: MrSensible

content:
Forget about CSS then, even though it is no less difficult nor riskier than registry changes.

Compact Headers add-on is dead easy and works.

Card view would only be helpful if you changed over to View > Layout > Vertical, which would give you the full screen height to display each message. Step by step is at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-115-supernova-faq#w_how-do-i-get-the-thunderbird-115-supernova-look

content: Settings/Privacy & Security, Mail Content, Exceptions... to manage senders to allow/block remote content.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks. I've tried that a number of times today and in the past but it does not bring back the choice banner and there seems to be no way to do that. sometimes the remote content may be from other associated domains and so whitelisting the email source does not solve the problem. It is very puzzling and annoying that there is no way to change one's mind after clicking the wrong choice by mistake.
creator: allendick

content: In cases where remote content in a single message is loaded from several sources (associated domains), merely whitelisting the sender might not be sufficient. It's probably easier to just delete all entries from Exceptions and force the Options banner to appear for all new messages. Short of trying to figure out which domains to block or unblock, I don't know of any other way to reset.
creator: sfhowes

content:
HI Matt Yes on transfer list but closing email accounts as we speak as I use for business and cant rely on Netspace or Thunderbird at the moment.... According to iinet, my emails have not been transferred yet but they are having huge problems with Thunderbird & Outlook express. Their only suggestion is to remove and re-add email to Thunderbird. I did that with one mailbox under their instruction and never saw an email or folder from this mailbox again. I am closing that one in a couple of days. Incoming is still working. Outgoing not. Both work from my phone with Safari

So the messages seem to be different each day... here is a sample From movieart@netspace.net.au Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.iinet.net.au. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'.

From akj@netspace.net.au Login to server mail.iinet.net.au with username movieart@netspace.net.au failed. (today) Previously... Sending of the message failed. An error occured while sending mail. Outgoing server(SMTP error. The server responeded: +OKpop3ready -cma-kakadu03

There has been an assortment of messages with different errors. iinet has spent 2x 2 hr blocks trying to restore. They cannot... Last technician said leave it for a few days and it might resolve itself. It hasnt... I have closed 3 mailboxes permanently and am now looking to move from Thunderbird

Any suggestions you may have will be appreciated. I have been with Netspace/ iinet for 25years and Thunderbird for as long as i can remember. Never had this problem before Andrea

content: It is difficult to advise you, as I see no reason to be editing or searching your outbox with a hex editor. Thunderbird has an addon ecosystem that is more than capable of getting to address information from pending outgoing mails, without resorting to a hammer
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The only reason I mention using the hex editor was pointing out that I was familiar with various file structures on a byte by byte basis. I am hoping to write an external program using the Lazarus compiler. I've already written a fair amount of code for reading the messages but don't have a field structure that would allow me to have my program automatically write anything INTO the "unsent messages" file to remove any unsent messages that are in my "never send" type database of email addresses and/or domains. I could use the same blocked domain list for a message in/message out function that would block spam and prevent me from replying to someone that no longer exists.

Imagine being able to block messages from/to these domains just by looking only for the string following the @ character in each one. I'm fairly sure we don't wish to receive daily email from each of these.

content: My first thought is to set up a filter for the project, assuming there is some element within each message that would identify it. Maybe more information on how the emails for a project are identified, or is this a manual step that you do?
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David,

Thanks for your reply.

Messages come in to Outlook 2003 and when I have dealt with that particular message I manually move it to a project directory in Outlook 2003, together with any message I have sent. This directory is specific to one project and all emails pertaining to that project sit there. Once that project is complete and email correspondence ceases, then using MessageSave, I manually select that project directory and save all the emails to the main project directory on C:.

When I send an email I always preface the subject area with the project number, however, my correspondents (client, contractor, local authority, suppliers etc.) often put their own "subject" so identification for me is a manual process.
creator: graham3443

content:
Thunderbird will save individual emails as EML files. It will not (I don't think) save a folder to the file system with it's contents. The import export tools addon will. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/?src=ss It also provides the option of individual EML fioles for each email, or an MBOX file that is essentially a Thunderbird folder of emails, but it needs to be imported to Thunderbird to use.

Or

You create the folder and then select all the emails in the list (Ctrl+A) and then save the messages to the folder.

Personally I have Thunderbird set to place a copy of message replies in the folder of the email I am replying to. That way using message threading I have everything but my initial email in the same folder and if I initiated the contact, I move the initial email from sent to the folder with the replies. This does not move the message from the inbox to the project folder. But it automates some of it.

This addon by Axel Grude has been around a long time and is well regarded. It may well offer to automate the initial filing if you want to step away from the inbox as much as possible. It is not on my list of addons, but the addon assistant part of things might make the difference between using a filter and not.

If I am struggling to identify the correct "topic" I use the right click open in conversation menu item and it will "locate" other emails in the thread of discussion based on the references header of the email. It is a handy fall back when other linking options fail. (labels in subject)

Some other addons you might find useful in project management are;

  • Smart Templates by the same author https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/smarttemplate4/?src=ss it makes customized replies a simply process and enables substitution for preset variable with recipient details from the address book etc.
  • Quicktext https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/quicktext is in some ways similar to smart templates, except it is about inserting boiler plate into the message you are typing. privacy statements, signatures and a host of other repetitive text options.
  • Xnote for when you need a sticky note for that email. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/xnotepp/
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hi Chris,

Thank you for that link - that's a good start, and it's led me to some more questions based on what I've picked up from studying the "msgFilterRules.dat" file, specifically as to whether any documentation exists that would help me with parts of a message filter.

I'll quote an example from my own "msgFilterRules.dat" file with some names changed for privacy protection (please note that I do have the "quickFilters" and "FiltaQuilla" extensions installed so I do have access so some additional actions/options):

  • Apply when: Manually Run, Getting New Mail (Filter Before Junk Classification)
  • Match all of the following:
  • From contains ACME Inc
  • Actions:
  • Mark As Read
  • Save Message As File: ACME Inc on file system
  • Move Message To: ACME Inc on Local Folders

Now when I look at my "msgFilterRules.dat" file, I see this rule stored as follows:

  • name="ACME Inc"
  • enabled="yes"
  • type="17"
  • action="Mark read"
  • action="Custom"
  • customId="filtaquilla@mesquilla.com#saveMessageAsFile"
  • actionValue="ACME Inc on file system"
  • action="Move to folder"
  • actionValue="mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/ACME%20Inc"
  • condition="AND (from,contains,ACME Inc)"

Some of these are obvious than others: but I'm wondering if the possible values for the "type", "action", "actionValue" and "condition" entries are documented anywhere? Or would it benefit me to join the development volunteers and get access to Thunderbird's source code so I can find it for myself?

Many thanks in advance,

Richard
creator: RichardWattCoventry

content:
Try the source https://searchfox.org/comm-central/source/mailnews/search/src/nsMsgFilter.cpp

I have never seen any real documentation of even how it is supposed to work.

content:
Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX

content:
My question to you is why post your feedback in a peer support forum? Just be aware that the developers and the paid employees tend not to appear here at all. You get peers in a peer support forum. Certainly not paid developers.

There is a feedback link on the Thunderbird help menu, along with the link to this forum.

- multiple folders can't be selected in the same time

Why would you want to select multiple folders at the same time? I honestly can not think of a single reason to select more than one folder at a time. Given drag and drop and most functions ignored any folder after the first anyway and yet others simply messed up I am rather glad multiple selections are missing. Folk thought the folder pane should work like windows file explorer, and it never did.

- Customized icon function also has been removed

Customized icon how? Application? Folder? I do not recall being able to modify folder icons ever. But please expand on this so I can understand.

- TB always makes folders' file corrupted, folders always must be repaired time to time

No idea what you are talking about. I have had folder corruption maybe a dozen times in as many years and never since I got rid of Third party antivirus products and bought an SSD drive. But it would underline your complaints about correspondents and threads as the rebuild/reindex process does not have regard to those personalizations.

- TB time to time gets stuck during email sending and when I restart TB it removes the email from the Draft so I lose my already written email

Stuck how. Either the mail sends via the server or it reports an error is my experience over the past decade or so. It does not just hang there like a lost child at a fair. But as I said I don't have third party antivirus which appears to contribute quite a bit to that sort of issue. Bringing all sorts of issues, including self signed encryption certificates to the table that sometime simply prevent a stable connection. You could log the issue to determine exactly what the delay is. https://wiki.mozilla.org/MailNews:Logging

- TB always turns on f*cking Threads view on all news folder but Thread view is disabled

Disabled how? Did you follow the instructions here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird#w_changing-default-threading-mode I find the threading, like the correspondents column tend to reset if the actual default is not changed. Especially in folder repairs.

- TB always uses Correspondents column instead of "From", "Recipient" and "Size", I can't set a customized default view.

That is truly painful, but it has been going on ever since they invented the correspondent column. Periodically I will notice my inbox has no column for sender. But it is hardly something that can be parked at the door of supernova. The inability to resize the filters dialog. That appear to be a supernova issue.

My understanding is using the Config Editor to set mailnews.ui.upgrade.correspondents set to false. will prevent the insertion of the column the first time you select the folder. But that was 8 years ago, so it might not work that way now. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1152706#c40 But it does reinforce my point that the issue is not new.

- I always have to restart the TB after a few days because it becomes very slow

Have you undertaken any investigation of the issue? See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Memory_Usage_Problems The discussion is memory problems, but it sounds like that is what you are talking about as slowing down is almost always related to memory. Fundamentally the diagnostic steps are mostly the same whatever issue you are trying to diagnose, outside of the logging steps.

Since Supernova has been released we almost each day got calls from our clients and complain about TB why it is getting more useless day by day. So it is a sad story but true. Thanks, Zsolt

Actually blanket it sucks stories have little or no interest to me. I am always looking for specifics and I know when filing a bug developers live on facts and steps to reproduce. So what are the issues, beyond your clients not knowing how to use the new version with it's modified layouts and user interface changes that are not really as good in my opinion as those who developed them think they are.
creator: MattAuSupport

Try this: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete folderTree.json and open the subfolder of Mail with your account files, e.g. Mail/pop.mail.yahoo.com.
